column4: Can you help me? My Ubuntu freezes. Repeatedly.  Is 9.10, up from 9.04. 32 bit AMD. No fancy stuff. Use xchat, FF, Chrome, Transmission.  --- someone asked me about what dmesg says... This is it. http://pastebin.com/UgYqvvcX
are you using an external storage device to run your ubuntu 9.10 Karamic Koala?
no
no I am not using any external storage device
actually, since most of the ubuntus Karmic are available in 64 bit version, its difficult for your 32 bit AMD to hold the instruction set long enough for executing
i see
I do not have a 64 bit machine, do I?
so i think, you must make sure that you are running a 32 bit i386 version OS on the system
no u dont
but ur OS is 64 bit
it is?
yes it is
did you order a CD or downloaded it from the net?
can I reinstall Ubuntu with the correct version without wiping my hard drive.
if so, i am 101 % sure about the OS being a 64 bit one.
yes u can
well for it, you will only have to erase the boot loader and the MBR.
and then start ubuntu  in live mode
and select a partition where no OS resides
right ZykoticK9
and ZykoticK9   --> uname -m
